story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Gravel One Fifty land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Gravel One Fifty? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Gravel One Fifty scored 47 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Gravel One Fifty?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Gravel One Fifty. Roden, Drenthe, Netherlands. 93 mi. Dutch flat gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: Gravel One Fifty | Roden, Drenthe, Netherlands | 93 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Length. 4 out of 5. This is a long day. Plan accordingly. Elite men averaged 36 km/h over 150km with winner Jordan Habets finishing in 4:06:45 after a late attack just kilometers from the line. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Adequate. The word was invented for this. Winner Jordan Habets celebrated victory covered in Drenthe dust at the Roden Brink town square finish, with spectators lining crossroads throughout the course ringing cowbells. Climate. 3 out of 5. The weather could go either way. Experience. 3 out of 5. Memorable course. Has character. James Ion described 2025 as transforming 'normally tranquil forest and farm roads into a high-speed playground' under ideal conditions. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. Nearly 2,000 participants from 26 countries created strong international field, with organizers noting the Brink 'turned sporty, atmospheric, and a bit dusty. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. €95 for 150km UCI qualifier with nearly 2,000 participants and spectator-lined course delivers solid European race value. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Adventure. 2 out of 5. Some interesting terrain. Mostly familiar. Route connects 'stunning and diverse cycling sites' through mix of dirt roads, gravel roads and grass sections across Drenthe countryside.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest. Quick-fire. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Regional reputation. The locals know. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Not cheap. The costs pile on. Elevation. 1 out of 5. Elevation gain measured in speed bumps. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: Where Gravel One Fifty earns its score.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Amsterdam 2 hours or Groningen 30 minutes
Lodging: Roden has moderate lodging options.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Dutch Flat Gravel. If you're in Netherlands/Europe and want a local event. yes, it's solid. If you're international. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Gravel One Fifty isn't quite right for you. For similar regional events: other Dutch gravel races. For more elevation: Belgian or German gravel races.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Gravel One Fifty? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Gravel One Fifty' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.

production_checklist: [ ] B-roll sourced (check broll_sources in each beat)
[ ] Music track selected (check BPM targets per beat)
